attributes.action: Publicly apologise to all UK citizens for Her Majesty's government's total abrogation of its duty to protect its citizens
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The government has just permitted the rendition of a British Citizen to the notorious justice system of the USA. He faces a custodial sentence of up to 60 years in a high security penitentiary
for an alleged crime committed in the UK. His punishment in the UK, if found guilty, should be for a minor, non-violent misdemeanor. British 
citizens have also been abused through
this government's 'outsourcing' their torture and collaborating with foreign agencies carrying out the torture of
British citizens. I feel that an apology is due.
Promises of 'lessons learned' and 'improvements will be made' are not required as these would only be met with the same disbelief as all of the
previous promises made by the government regarding protection of human rights.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
